items.title: US calls ChatGPT executive in Google antitrust case
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The DOJ has called Nick Turley, head of product at OpenAI’s ChatGPT, to testify in its antitrust case against Google.
- This follows a 2024 ruling classifying Google as a monopoly in search, which Google is currently appealing.
- Turley will testify about generative AI's role in search, data-sharing, and market access.
- Google has subpoenaed OpenAI for documents dating back to before ChatGPT’s 2022 launch, which OpenAI is contesting as excessive.
- A court intervention is being sought to limit Google's demands; the testimony date remains pending.

items.title: Apple, Google remove TikTok from their US app stores
items.summary:
- Apple and Google removed TikTok from US app stores on Jan. 18 after a Supreme Court decision upheld the ban.
- TikTok has confirmed that it has stopped operations nationwide.
- Users now see messages indicating TikTok is unavailable when trying to access the app.
- Other ByteDance services, like Lemon8, are also unavailable in the US.
- President-elect Donald Trump hinted at a potential 90-day extension for TikTok to comply with the law.

items.title: Zomato invests $57.7m in Blinkit amid quick commerce race
items.summary:
- Zomato has invested approximately 500 crore rupees (around US$57.7 million) in Blinkit, its quick commerce subsidiary.
- Blinkit issued 2,537 equity shares at 19.7 lakh rupees (around US$22,754) each as part of this investment.
- This funding follows Zomato's prior fundraising of 8,500 crore rupees (around US$980.9 million) through its first qualified institutional placement (QIP).
- From the QIP, 2,137 crore rupees (around US$246.6 million) were allocated for developing Blinkit's dark stores and Hyperpure's warehouses.
- Zomato has made a total investment of 2,300 crore rupees (around US$265.4 million) in Blinkit since its acquisition in August 2022, including a previous investment of 300 crore rupees (around US$34.6 million) in June 2024.

items.title: OpenAI prepares to roll out o3 mini AI model
items.summary:
- OpenAI plans to release its new AI model, o3 mini, in the coming weeks.
- CEO Sam Altman announced that the launch will include an API and integrate user feedback with ChatGPT.
- The initial launch was targeted for January 2025, with a full o3 model expected later.
- These models aim to enhance OpenAI’s capabilities in tackling complex tasks in science, coding, and mathematics.
- This announcement occurs amidst growing competition in the AI industry, particularly from Alphabet, Google's parent company.

items.title: Creators urge Biden to protect TikTok from upcoming ban
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- TikTok users urge U.S. government to prevent a ban on the app scheduled for Jan. 19.
- A lawyer for content creators requested assurance from the Biden administration regarding TikTok's availability in app stores.
- The letter calls for a delay in enforcing the law until clearer guidelines are issued, warning that TikTok could cease operations under new regulations.

items.title: Trump ‘most likely’ to give TikTok 90-day extension to avoid ban
items.summary:
- Trump is considering a 90-day extension for TikTok to avoid a ban.
- The extension would provide TikTok more time to negotiate terms with the U.S. government.
- This decision indicates ongoing discussions about TikTok's operations in the U.S. amid security concerns.

items.title: Perplexity said to bid to merge with TikTok US amid looming ban
items.summary:
- Perplexity is reportedly looking to merge with TikTok US.
- This bid comes amidst a potential ban on TikTok in the US.
- The implications of the merger could shape the future of both companies and their operations in America.

items.title: American EV startup Canoo files for bankruptcy, ceases operations
items.summary:
- American electric vehicle (EV) startup Canoo filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy on Jan. 17.
- The company ceased operations due to significant financial difficulties, a high cash burn rate, and challenges in securing funding.
- Canoo's cargo vans had a unique design inspired by microbuses but struggled to gain traction in the competitive EV market.

items.title: US warns of risks in Microsoft’s $13b OpenAI investment
items.summary:
- The FTC has raised concerns about the power of major tech firms in AI, including Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.
- A report dated January 16 highlights risks with partnerships between big tech and AI startups, such as data advantages and resource consolidation.
- Specific examples include Microsoft's $13 billion investment in OpenAI and partnerships by Amazon and Google with Anthropic.
- Concerns include lock-in effects limiting startups and exclusive AI talent access.
- Criticism was directed at circular spending practices benefiting tech companies' products.
- An ongoing FTC investigation could inform future antitrust actions to ensure fair competition in AI.

items.title: TikTok CEO praises Trump for support amid looming ban
items.summary:
- TikTok CEO expresses gratitude towards Trump for his support during a potential U.S. ban.
- The company's future in the U.S. market is uncertain amid ongoing political tensions and regulatory scrutiny.
- TikTok continues to seek solutions to maintain compliance and sustain its user base in the U.S.

items.title: China Tightens Export Restrictions Impacting Apple’s Supply
items.summary:
- China has introduced new export restrictions that affect key materials used in semiconductor manufacturing.
- These restrictions potentially impact Apple's supply chain and production capabilities.
- The changes are part of ongoing trade tensions between China and the United States, with implications for global technology markets.

items.title: Biden’s $52b Chips Act entering new phase under Trump
items.summary:
- The US government’s $52 billion Chips and Science Act aims to revitalize the semiconductor industry.
- Oversight will transition from the Biden administration to Donald Trump’s team on Jan. 20.
- The Biden administration allocated $39 billion to the program, leading to over $400 billion in private investments.
- There are 20 finalized agreements and 14 preliminary deals, but challenges remain in the semiconductor sector.
- TSMC has started production in Phoenix; advanced manufacturing will follow.
- Intel is experiencing delays and leadership changes, while Samsung has reduced its Texas investment.

items.title: VinFast launches two EV models in India
items.summary:
- VinFast has launched VF 6 and VF 7 electric vehicle models in India at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025.
- These are VinFast's first right-hand drive EVs designed specifically for the Indian market.
- Sales are expected to start in the second half of 2025 with plans to appoint dealers in major cities.
- The company is constructing an EV manufacturing facility in Tamil Nadu to boost local production.

items.title: US settles $20m privacy case with Genshin Impact developer
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The US has settled a $20 million privacy lawsuit with the developer of Genshin Impact, miHoYo.
- The case was related to improper data handling practices by the company.
- This settlement is significant as it reflects growing scrutiny on tech companies regarding user privacy.

items.title: Variety is the spice of life 🌶️
items.summary:
- The newsletter covers diverse funding deals in sectors like medical, ecommerce, and gaming.
- Neuberg Diagnostics raised US$109 million in investments; Cornerstone Robotics secured US$70 million.
- Notable mentions include Mirxes (US$40 million), Grand Games (US$30 million), and PrettyDamnQuick (US$25 million).
- A total of 59 deals worth over US$570 million reported this week.
- Fundraising startups listed for investor outreach; platform Glasswall allows founders to review investors.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Singapore’s startups
TikTok, Shein, others sued over unlawful data transfers to China
items.summary:
- TikTok, Shein, and other companies are being sued for allegedly transferring user data unlawfully to China.
- The lawsuit aims to address concerns over data privacy and security for users.
- The plaintiffs seek accountability for potential breaches of data protection laws.

items.title: Biden passes TikTok ban enforcement to Trump administration
items.summary:
- The TikTok ban is set to take effect on Jan. 19, with enforcement passed to President-elect Donald Trump.
- The Supreme Court upheld legislation requiring ByteDance, TikTok's parent company, to divest ownership due to national security concerns.
- Enforcement details are unclear as Trump is set to take office before the ban's implementation.
- Biden's administration has been hesitant to impose penalties for non-compliance with the ban.
- Trump, who previously supported a TikTok ban, is uncertain about his approach this time.
- Reports indicate TikTok's future operations may face temporary shutdowns, though no official plans are announced.

items.title: JD.com unveils gifting feature ahead of Lunar New Year
items.summary:
- JD.com has launched a new gifting feature in time for the upcoming Lunar New Year.
- This feature aims to enhance user experience by allowing customers to send gifts directly through the platform.
- The gifting option is expected to boost sales during this significant holiday period in China.

items.title: TSMC faces delays at Arizona chip plant
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- TSMC is experiencing delays in the construction of its chip plant in Arizona.
- The delays are attributed to various factors affecting the project timeline.
- There are implications for the semiconductor supply chain due to this setback.

items.title: Microsoft’s AI investments under scrutiny amid 10% stock dip
items.summary:
- Microsoft faces a notable 10% stock dip, raising questions about its AI investments.
- Investors and analysts are scrutinizing the effectiveness and impact of Microsoft's AI strategy.
- The decline in stock price reflects growing concerns among stakeholders regarding future profitability.

items.title: WeChat debuts gift-giving via mini programs, up to $1k
items.summary:
- WeChat launched a new gift-giving feature on January 17.
- Users can send gifts via chat or by searching for "gifts" in the app.
- The feature is available for most WeChat Mini Program products, excluding jewelry and education items.
- Eligible products must not exceed an original price of 10,000 yuan (around $1,365).
- Users can select a product, confirm payment, and choose a recipient; the recipient can exchange the gift for another of equal value before delivery.

items.title: EU intensifies probe into X over potential compliance violation
items.summary:
- The European Union is escalating its investigation into company X regarding potential compliance violations.
- This probe may have significant implications for X's operations within the EU market.
- Previous concerns about compliance issues have prompted this intensified scrutiny from EU authorities.

items.title: NEV maker Neta Auto said to secure funding, overhaul operations
items.summary:
- Neta Auto has reportedly secured approximately 6 billion in funding, with undisclosed currency denomination.
- Funding contributions involved state-owned assets and battery maker CATL.
- Company restructuring efforts focus on financial stability, vehicle production, and stable aftermarket parts supply.
- Neta Auto aims to manufacture 1,000 vehicles by mid-January and 4,000 by the end of February.

items.title: Apple suspends AI news summaries amid accuracy concerns
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Apple has halted its AI news summary feature due to concerns over content accuracy.
- The decision arose amidst feedback regarding the reliability of the AI-generated summaries.
- Apple aims to improve the technology before reintroducing the feature.

items.title: Vietnam’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most funded tech companies in Vietnam over the last decade.
- It highlights trends in investment and growth within the Vietnamese tech ecosystem.
- Key companies and their funding rounds are presented to illustrate the landscape of the tech industry in Vietnam.

items.title: Intel’s stock jumps amid buyout rumors
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Intel's stock experienced a significant increase due to rumors of a potential buyout.
- The rumors have sparked interest among investors, leading to higher trading volumes.
- Analysts are speculating on the implications of such a buyout for Intel's market position and future strategy.

items.title: Samsung ties executive bonuses to stock performance
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics will start linking executive bonuses to stock performance from January 2025.
- The stock-based bonus will comprise 50% to 100% of the annual bonus, depending on seniority.
- Executives will be prohibited from selling shares for one to two years.
- This change comes as Samsung competes in the semiconductor market and faces challenges from SK Hynix in AI memory chip production.
- The bonus system will adjust based on market performance; a drop in stock price means fewer shares for executives.
- There are plans to extend this program to non-executive employees by 2026, with voluntary participation and no market performance link.

items.title: EU reaffirms Big Tech oversight amid Trump’s return
items.author: Henna Virkkunen
items.summary:
- The European Union continues its strict oversight of Big Tech under the Digital Services Act (DSA).
- Henna Virkkunen confirmed that investigations into platforms like X, Meta, and TikTok are still active.
- Concerns have arisen about US tech companies using Trump's return to counter EU regulations, particularly regarding compliance and disinformation.

items.title: Trump said to sign executive order that prioritizes crypto policy
items.summary:
- Trump is set to sign an executive order focusing on cryptocurrency policy.
- The order will prioritize the development and regulation of cryptocurrencies.
- The move is seen as significant for the future of crypto in the U.S.

items.title: Honor CEO George Zhao resigns ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- George Zhao announced his resignation as CEO of Honor on January 17 for personal and health reasons.
- Jian Li will succeed Zhao as CEO, having four years of experience in senior management at Honor.
- Zhao's resignation comes as Honor looks to finalize its IPO announced in 2023.
- Honor became independent from Huawei in 2020 and is focusing on global expansion and high-end smartphone development, including foldable models.

items.title: Bumble’s founder will return as CEO in March
items.author: Whitney Wolfe Herd
items.summary:
- Bumble Inc. announced Whitney Wolfe Herd will return as CEO in mid-March 2025.
- Wolfe Herd, currently executive chair, succeeds Lidiane Jones, who steps down for personal reasons.
- Ann Mather will become the chair of the board of directors alongside Wolfe Herd's appointment.

items.title: TikTok may halt US operations amid regulatory uncertainty
items.summary:
- TikTok announced potential halt of operations in the US starting January 19.
- The decision follows the Supreme Court's upholding of a law to ban the platform.
- Over 170 million US users could be affected by the ban.

items.title: India’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article provides a visual representation of India's startup funding landscape.
- It discusses key trends, data points, and charts reflecting the growth and challenges of startups in India.
- Various funding rounds and amounts for different sectors are highlighted, offering insights into investor behavior and market dynamics.
- The funding data spans multiple years, showcasing patterns and shifts in the startup ecosystem.

items.title: GoTo CEO unfazed by VinFast’s Indonesia entry
items.author: Patrick Walujo
items.summary:
- GoTo CEO Patrick Walujo expresses confidence despite VinFast's entry into Indonesia's transportation market.
- Walujo differentiates Gojek's ride-hailing model from VinFast's automotive manufacturing focus.
- VinFast recently launched its electric taxi service in Indonesia, marking its second international venture.
- The electric vehicle market in Indonesia is becoming increasingly competitive with numerous options available.
- GoTo has shifted its focus back to Indonesia and Singapore after withdrawing from Vietnam, but still struggles for profitability.
- Walujo has committed to continue as CEO for another five years but is open to succession in the future if necessary.

items.title: US Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The US Supreme Court has ruled to uphold the ban on TikTok.
- The decision reflects growing concerns over data privacy and national security.
- The ruling is seen as a significant development in ongoing debates about digital privacy and the regulation of social media platforms.

items.title: UAE sovereign fund clashes with Turkish startup over ownership
items.summary:
- Dispute between Turkish startup Getir and investor Mubadala Investment Co. escalating at an extraordinary general meeting in Amsterdam.
- Mubadala claims a new transaction agreement for Getir, aimed at ensuring financial stability, has been approved by independent board members.
- Central issue involves accusation that Getir's founders did not finalize a restructuring deal from June 2023.
- Getir co-founder Nazim Salur denies claims, arguing that Mubadala seeks to eliminate founders’ ownership stake.
- Other investors in Getir include Alpha Wave Global, Sequoia Capital, Tiger Global, and Turkish firms Revo Capital and Esas Holding.
- Shareholders to vote on Mubadala’s proposed transaction this weekend.

items.title: US probes Chinese tech firm founded by ex-Huawei execs
items.summary:
- The US is investigating a Chinese technology firm established by former executives of Huawei.
- The inquiry focuses on potential security concerns related to the firm's operations and technology.
- The investigation highlights ongoing tensions between the US and China regarding technology and espionage fears.

items.title: Nvidia shifts AI chip packaging strategy
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Nvidia is changing its approach to AI chip packaging to improve efficiency.
- This shift aims to enhance performance and reduce costs for AI chip production.
- The decision reflects increasing competition and demand for advanced AI technologies.

items.title: China investigates US chip subsidies
items.summary:
* China launches an investigation into US subsidies for semiconductor companies.
* The investigation is part of ongoing trade tensions between China and the US.
* It aims to assess the impact of US subsidies on Chinese firms and the global semiconductor industry.
* This move could potentially escalate the technology rivalry between the two countries.

items.title: Reliance’s Jio posts 26% profit growth in Q3 FY25
items.summary:
- Jio Platforms recorded a 26% year-on-year net profit growth in Q3 FY25, totaling 6,861 crore rupees (approx. US$798 million).
- Revenue from operations increased by 19.2% year-on-year to 33,074 crore rupees (approx. US$3.8 billion).
- Average revenue per user (ARPU) rose to 203.3 rupees (approx. US$2.3), up from 181.7 rupees (approx. US$2.1) last year.
- Subscriber base grew by 2.4% year-on-year to 482 million, with 3.3 million new subscribers added this quarter.
- Jio has over 170 million 5G customers, representing 40% of its total wireless traffic.

items.title: Lessons from the SingPost saga
items.summary:
- The article discusses the operational challenges faced by SingPost.
- It emphasizes the importance of transparency and communication in corporate governance.
- The saga highlights lessons for other companies regarding risk management and stakeholder engagement.

items.title: Douyin allows international registration, but limits apply
items.summary:
- Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok, is now allowing international registrations.
- There are specific restrictions and limits associated with these registrations.
- The article explores the implications of this move on Douyin's global strategy.

items.title: Ex-OpenAI CTO Murati’s AI lab hires former execs
items.author: Mira Murati
items.summary:
- Mira Murati, ex-CTO of OpenAI, begins hiring for her new AI research lab.
- First hires include Jonathan Lachman, ex-head of special projects at OpenAI.
- The lab is in early stages, focused on artificial general intelligence, without a name or product strategy yet.
- Murati has recruited around 10 experts from OpenAI, Character AI, and Google DeepMind.
- She left OpenAI in September 2024 and aims to raise over $100 million for this new venture.
